{{cpp/string/basic_string/title|empty}}
{{cpp/string/basic_string/navbar}}
{{ddcla|noexcept=c++11|constexpr=c++20|
bool empty() const;
}}

Checks if the string has no characters, i.e. whether {{c|1=begin() == end()}}.

===Parameters===
(none)

===Return value===
{{c|true}} if the string is empty, {{c|false}} otherwise

===Complexity===
Constant.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;string&gt;

int main()
{
    std::string s;
    std::boolalpha(std::cout);
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "s.empty():" &lt;&lt; s.empty() &lt;&lt; "\t s:'" &lt;&lt; s &lt;&lt; "'\n";

    s = "Exemplar";
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "s.empty():" &lt;&lt; s.empty() &lt;&lt; "\t s:'" &lt;&lt; s &lt;&lt; "'\n";

    s = "";
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "s.empty():" &lt;&lt; s.empty() &lt;&lt; "\t s:'" &lt;&lt; s &lt;&lt; "'\n";
}
|output=
s.empty():true   s:''
s.empty():false  s:'Exemplar'
s.empty():true   s:''
}}
